intro: Rhynchospora brevifoliata, commonly known as the short-leaved spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features slender, triangular stems and small, clustered spikelets that are typically green to reddish in color. Its leaves are short and narrow, with a distinctive waxy coating that helps it thrive in moist environments. Rhynchospora brevifoliata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
